alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 2:45PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Cooler and Breezy 4th of July Weekend... * Noticeably cooler temperatures at least 10-15 degrees below average are expected Sunday and Independence Day. Highs in the low 80s are possible in the lower valleys with upper-60s to low- 70s in Sierra valleys. This may feel like an abrupt change for many, especially in mountain communities. * Enhanced westerly winds to 30-35 mph and dry conditions are expected areawide Saturday through Independence day. Avoid causing sparks near dry vegetation. As always follow local fire and firework restrictions. * Showers and thunderstorms are possible Sunday and Independence Day across northeast California and northwestern Nevada. Make sure to stay up-to-date with the most recent forecast and plan your outdoor activities accordingly.

area.areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California
